newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Budapest bourse ends mixed, index closes lower.
newsitem.headline: Budapest bourse ends mixed, index closes lower.

text.p: Hungarian share prices closed mixed on the Budapest Stock Exchange on Wednesday, traders said, adding that while closing prices showed modest changes over yesterday the intraday changes were sharp.

The BUX index ended at 3,493.49 points, down 20.29. BUX index futures ended higher for the three closest maturities, firmed a half point for June 1997, and remained unchanged for the two farest terms.
Spot share turnover totalled 1.17 billion forints, BUX index futures deals generated 233.6 million forints.
As reflected by the index the market went through some correction, traders said, adding that while the short-term outlook was trendless, the long-term tendency is seen bullish.
"The market just can't decide which direction to go to," Attila Gazdik of New York Broker Budapest said.
Many investors may emerge with the intention of profit-taking, traders said, adding that at the same time, with a positive long-term outlook, many may decide to start to open new long positions.
"Many may regard current share prices quite attractive and the main question of the coming day will be how many decide to take profit," Gazdik said.
"Nevertheless, I don't fear the rising trend would break."
Traders said changes in expectations for a rate hike in the U.S. will remain one of the key influencing factors.
On Wednesday OTP Bank was a heavy gainer as it rose to peak at 2,615 forints, although later came down to end at 2,600, up 100.
